text: Helen Marie Yate (1 January 1921 - 11 August 2020) was a British swimmer. She competed in the women's 100 metre backstroke at the 1948 Summer Olympics. She represented England and won a silver medal and two bronze medals at the 1950 British Empire Games. She was born in Plymouth, Devon. Yate died on 11 August 2020 at a nursing home in Plymouth at the age of 99.Helen Marie Yate ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2020 deaths Category:British swimmers Category:Olympians for Great Britain Category:People from Plymouth Category:Sportspeople from Devon
title: Helen Yate
